docs.lead_paragraph: BROOKLYN BOARD OF HEALTH--A meeting of this Board was held on Tuesday, when, after order ing a number of nuisances abated permits, were grant ed to the following vessels to land cargo: Ship Razee, from Liverpool, with salt and coal; bark E. Sherwood, from Santa Cruz, with sugar; bark America, from Cardenas, with molasses; bark J. Payson, from Cardenas, with sugar; schooner J. Cassidy, from Trinidad, with molasses; brig Sally,

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; Consols 93 7-8 @ 94. [By the American Telegraph Company's Lines--Office, 21 Wall-st.] COTTON STEADY-BREADSTUFFS LOWER, Expectations of Hostilities Between Spain and Mexico. BREAD RIOTS IN SPAIN. Arrival of the Europa at Halifax. The Niagara to Recieve her Share of the Submarine Cable. Tranquility Restored in Belgium

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail Steamship Europa, Captain LEITCH, from Liverpool, at 9 A. M., on Saturday, June 6, arrived at this port, at 5 o'clock this morning. The Canadian Screw Steamer Indian, from Quebec arrived at Liverpool, at 2 A. M., on the 4th. The screw-steamer Kangaroo left Liverpool on the 3d, for New-York, and the U. S. Mail steamship Fulton, left Southampton on the same day for New-York.
docs.abstract: Eng. share of the redemption money voted

headline.main: LAW INTELLIGENCE.; SURROGATE'S COURT Further Testimony for the claimant--Examination of Dr. David Uhl, C. G. Gunther, Governor of the Alms.House, Mr. Gilmore, Dr. Ware--Dr. Burdell Pays Mrs. Cunninghum's Medical Bills. THE BURDELL ESTATE. COURT CALENDAR- COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS. MARINE COURT. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS. SUPREME COURT-- SPECIAL TERM--June 16.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Surrogate sat at 10 o'clock this morning, when testimony for the claimant was resumed. TESTIMONY OF DR. DAVID UHL. Dr. David Uhl was first called, and testified: I am a physician, residing at East Twentieth-street; knew Dr. Burdell for two years; first became acquainted with him in October, 1855; he got me to attend a lady at his house;

docs.lead_paragraph: Quarantine Affairs. DOMINICK RAGANS, who has been complained of for repeated violations of the Quarantine laws, was held to bail, under a Bench warrant, upon three separate indictments, in $300 each. The statement of RAGANS and his associates, that the vessel had re ceived a clearance from the Health Officer, before he boarded or held communication with her, is pro nounced untrue; besides, the offence against theQuarantine regulations consists in going upon the

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN HAVANA.; New Steamship Line--The Expedition against Mexico--The Slave-Trade--The Speculative Mania in Havana--Miscellaneous News.

docs.abstract: Gen. Marti sells out his Theatre, Fishery etc
docs.snippet: Gen. Marti sells out his Theatre, Fishery etc

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States mail steamship Vanderbill, from Havre on the 2d and Southampton on the 3d inst., arrived at this port early yesterday morning. The news, which is four days later, is not impor tant. We learn from Madrid that negotiations in relation to the Spanish-Mexican dispute have taken an unfavorable turn, and apprehensions of a warare once more revived.
